title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are expected to be active in free agency, with about $45 million below the second luxury tax threshold.
Insiders predict Boston is a strong contender to re-sign Alex Bregman and pursue Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso.
Red Sox are also linked to international star Munetaka Murakami and pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
Legend's setlist included tracks from 'Get Lifted' and a variety of covers, highlighting his varied musical influences.
The performance showcased Legend's ability to balance musical styles and emotional themes, drawing on his confidence and extensive experience.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticizes officiating after Celtics' 123-110 loss to Magic, implying referees influenced his fourth-quarter performance.
Brown previously criticized referees for a non-call in the Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Jazz, calling it a costly mistake.
The NBA acknowledged a missed foul in the Jazz game, but Brown was not fined for his comments on officiating.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield has completed 63.9% of his passes for 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and 2 interceptions this year.
Rookie wide receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 yards and 5 touchdowns, but struggled against man coverage and recent injuries.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks 7th in DVOA, with standout performances from Vita Vea, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game, their first Patriots game in over two years.
The appearance of CBS's top broadcast team suggests the Patriots have regained relevance in the NFL.
Nantz last called a Patriots home game in 2023 and looks forward to covering new quarterback Drake Maye.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, despite Jaylen Brown's impressive 32-point performance.
Jaylen Brown scored effectively inside the arc, but the Celtics' poor 3-point shooting hampered their efforts.
Paolo Banchero was quiet, but Franz Wagner and Desmond Bane led the Magic with 27 and 22 points, respectively.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph receives public reprimand recommendation for creating appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE-related case.
Hearing officer found insufficient evidence that Joseph authorized immigrant's escape, but noted impression of impropriety.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022, leading to state agency investigation of her conduct.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite losing the AL Wild Card Series to the Yankees.
Boston faces uncertainty in the offseason with Trevor Story opting in and Alex Bregman opting out of their contracts.
Cora praised the team's growth and highlighted rookie performances, noting the Red Sox are trending in the right direction.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75 to 100-foot blade from a 300-foot wind turbine detached and landed in a cranberry bog in Plymouth, MA.
The turbine automatically shut down with no injuries or public danger reported, according to local officials.
The incident is under investigation, with MassDEP and Inspectional Services involved in ensuring safe cleanup.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is now streaming on Disney+, introducing a new adaptation of Marvel's superhero family.
'Frankenstein,' Guillermo del Toro's unique take on Mary Shelley's classic, is streaming on Netflix.
'Death by Lightning,' a limited series about President James A. Garfield's story, is available on Netflix.
